posts.post_content: 4 CC is great for this very versitile card. I love having this card in a discard deck. Instant [Hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn to Tourach) and [Mind Twist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Twist) is incredibly evil! You can even get a first turn Vedalkin Orrery if you have a draw with an Orrery, a Swamp, a [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) and a [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring).

posts.post_content: I think it works best in a counterspell deck. With an Orrery in play, I never play cards during my turn, only during theirs. This way I've always got mana spare for counters, and if they don't play anything worth countering I can play my creatures at the end of their turn.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@dudecow:  
  
You would not be able to play planeswalkers' abilities during your opponent's turn. While you can play their abilities at any time you could play a sorcery, they are not sorceries (merely abilities with a timing restriction placed on them); Vedalken Orrery only applies to actual spells, not abilities.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@originalcardtext: [Hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn to Tourach) won't work with [isochron scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=isochron scepter) since it says it needs an instant card to be imprinted, also to be specific cycling is an activated ability  
  
The only thing I can see how this is useful is instant speed discard and your sorcery removals to be used as spot removals ie. [Flame Slash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flame Slash). Other than that [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir) is better (although he's blue and the orrery is an artifact, makes his use a little bitmore limited).

posts.post_content:
Also fun with [Progentius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progentius) and [Angelic Renewal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Renewal). [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper), [Natural Order](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Natural Order), [Fist of the Suns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fist of the Suns) etc..are some potentially fast ways to get him out.
  
   
I like the idea of instant discard :).
  
   
 On another note its fun to have [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter) + cmc <2 discard instant or sorcerry such as [Hymn to Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn to Tourach) and maybe a [Vedalken Orrery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Orrery) + perhaps something like [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir )  that way you can lock them out of their draw (by using Isochron Scepter's Hymn to Tourach at the end of your opponent's draw step) completely if all previously made cards are still unhampered with. For Multiplayer [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse) or something like it would help to lock out all others besides yourself or yourself too if you want.

posts.post_content:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but doesn't this let you go crazy with planeswalkers? The official rules says that you can play their abilities any time you could play a sorcery, and only if you haven't played any of it's abilities that turn. Since the Orrery lets you play sorceries during your opponents turn, can't you play planeswalkers abilities during yours *and* your opponent's turn?  
Edit: Wow, I'm an idiot. I got it completely wrong.

Posted By: DeathDark (7/4/2010 11:22:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think this card is currently somewhat overrated.
  
Yeah, it is a buffed version of [Vernal Equinox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vernal Equinox).
  
Of course, this allows you some combat tricks and a bunch of Sorceries and Creatures that are not meant to be cast in your opponent's turn allow some interesting combos.
  
*But* four mana is still a lot for this.
  
   
However, [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation) - despite the fact that it has the same converted mana cost - appears to be a nice alternative to this card when playing blue - especially as with all [Leyline](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline)s, it will allow you to play it for free if it's in your opening hand. Sounds far more appealing than being forced to spend turn four to play it.
posts.html:
I think this card is currently somewhat overrated.
Yeah, it is a buffed version of Vernal Equinox.
Of course, this allows you some combat tricks and a bunch of Sorceries and Creatures that are not meant to be cast in your opponent's turn allow some interesting combos.
But four mana is still a lot for this.

However, Leyline of Anticipation - despite the fact that it has the same converted mana cost - appears to be a nice alternative to this card when playing blue - especially as with all Leylines, it will allow you to play it for free if it's in your opening hand. Sounds far more appealing than being forced to spend turn four to play it.
